business.headline: Sensex, Nifty end lower in volatile session; Reliance jumps nearly 2%Stock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex ended 50.62 points lower to 78,148.49 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 18.95 points to 23,688.95.
PAN card fraud: Know details, how to stay safe from phishing scamA new phishing scam claiming PAN card updates is targeting India Post Payments Bank customers, with PIB urging caution.
Reliance share price jumps nearly 2%. Is there more upside and should you buy?Reliance share price: At 3:26 pm on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), RIL shares were trading 1.81% higher at Rs 1,263.30.

India's power output growth in 2024 slowest since pandemic: ReportThe deceleration was especially pronounced in the second half of the year, where power generation rose by only 2.3%, compared to a 9.6% rise in the first half.
Budget 2025: Can you expect Rs 10 lakh tax-free income?As Budget 2025 nears, the Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh calls for tax reforms, pension hikes, and worker benefits to ease middle-class burdens.

Sensex tumbles 600 points today. 3 reasons why stock market is falling Stock market today: Multiple factors were behind today's nervousness on Dalal Street, including weaker growth estimates for FY25, worries over Q3 corporate earnings and the likelihood of fewer US rate cuts.
'Real money is with Gujjus': Nithin Kamath on equity trade dominanceNithin Kamath revealed Mumbai and Ahmedabad drive 80% of equity trades, despite Gujarat having only 8% of registered investors.

Explained: Why Spandana Sphoorty share price surged over 15% todaySpandana Sphoorty share price: At around 10 am, Spandana Sphoorty shares were trading at Rs 461.40 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), marking a remarkable 35% gain in just two days. By 12:56 pm, the stock had risen 14.62% to Rs 459, signalling strong investor interest.

Delta Autocorp IPO: Check latest GMP, subscription status on Day 2Delta Autocorp IPO: The IPO opened for subscription on Tuesday and has already been subscribed 13.81 times as of the end of Day 1. By Wednesday afternoon, subscription levels continued to rise, with the issue subscribed 29.54 times as of 12:33 pm.

Budget 2025: Salaried earners up to Rs 15 lakh may get tax relief. Details hereBudget 2025-26 may offer tax benefits for incomes up to Rs 15 lakh, boosting disposable income and driving economic growth.

Zomato share price tumbles 3% today as poor market run continues. What's next?  Zomato's shares had already fallen nearly 5% in the previous session, contributing to an 11% drop over the past five trading days. Over the last month, the stock has lost more than 16% of its value.

Explained: Why Ola Electric share price fell over 5% todayOla Electric stock price: The shares of the company hit a low of Rs 75.36 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), down 4.8% during the session. At around 11:35 am, shares of the company recovered slightly, but were still trading 1.47% lower at Rs 78.

Quadrant Future Tek IPO Day 2: Check latest subscription, GMP and price band Quadrant Future Tek IPO: The grey market premium (GMP) for Quadrant Future Tek IPO stood at Rs 210 as of Wednesday, signalling a premium of approximately 73% over the issue's upper price band of Rs 290.
Explained: Why Indo Farm Equipment share price rose over 7% in early tradeOn January 7, Indo Farm Equipment's shares closed with a premium of over 27% against the issue price of Rs 215.

Indobell Insulation IPO Day 3: Check latest subscription status and GMPIndobell Insulation IPO: The Rs 10.14 crore initial public offering was fully subscribed on the first day itself and continues to attract bids as it enters its final day today, January 8.
Sensex, Nifty open lower amid weak sentiments; Reliance jumps 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 141.64 points to 78,057.47 at 10:09 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading 42.60 points lower at 23,665.30.
HDFC Bank introduces revised lending and FD rates. Check detailsHDFC Bank lowers MCLR by up to 5 bps, revises FD rates, offering financial relief and flexibility for borrowers and depositors.
ITR filing: Submit these investment proofs to claim deductions and save on TDSSubmit proofs promptly to reduce TDS, maximise tax savings, and ensure smooth compliance before filing your ITR.

India's GDP growth may hit 4-year low of 6.4% in FY25, shows government dataThe slowdown in the government's first advance estimates highlights a more tempered pace of economic activity and indicates that the economy could grow at the slowest pace in four years.
Sensex, Nifty recover after Monday's slump; RIL gains 2% The S&P BSE Sensex added 234.12 points to close at 78,199.11, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 91.85 points to end at 23,707.90.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Trinamool supports AAP in Delhi polls, Arvind Kejriwal says 'Thank you Didi'The Trinamool Congress has announced its support for the Aam Aadmi Party in the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections.

Sheikh Hasina's visa extended by India amid extradition demand: SourcesThe move comes against the backdrop of mounting demands from Bangladesh for Sheikh Hasina's extradition. Sources, however, refuted claims of Hasina being granted asylum.

AAP at PM house, BJP at Delhi Chief Minister's residence as bungalow row hots upThe Delhi Police thwarted AAP leaders' attempt to conduct a media tour at the Chief Minister's residence to counter BJP's allegations of luxurious renovation, resulting in a standoff.

Why couldn't Rahul Gandhi wait? Pranab Mukherjee's daughter on Vietnam trip rowSharmishtha Mukherjee's comments came about more than a week after the BJP accused the Congress of insensitivity in the wake of the alleged trip, triggering a fresh political row between the two parties.

What's Trump eyeing with claims on Canada, Panama Canal and GreenlandWeeks before his inauguration, US President-elect Donald Trump stated his intention to make Canada the 51st state of the US, retake the Panama Canal, and acquire Greenland from Denmark. Do the 78-year-old's territorial ambitions reflect mere desires, or do they show strategic, economic, security, and geopolitical foresight in a changing global order?

Budget 2025: Salaried earners up to Rs 15 lakh may get tax relief. Details hereBudget 2025-26 may offer tax benefits for incomes up to Rs 15 lakh, boosting disposable income and driving economic growth.

Yet to get 40 Tejas ordered in 2010: IAF chief as China tests sixth-gen jetsIndian Air Force (IAF) chief AP Singh has raised concerns over China's astonishing pace of air force modernisation while expressing frustration over the sluggish pace of the delivery of Tejas jets.

India to announce Champions Trophy 2025 squad before January 12: SourcesThe BCCI is expected to announce India's squad for the ICC Men's Champions Trophy 2025 by January 12, while the team for the five-match T20I series against England is likely to be revealed a day earlier.

What's the real story of tourism in Goa right now?Is tourism in Goa really declining, or are we missing an undercurrent, a positive one, that can reposition the state's identity as the "party capital of India"?

India probable squad: Yashasvi set to be considered; doubts over Shami, JadejaRohit Sharma and Virat Kohli remain central to India's ODI squad, but the futures of KL Rahul, Mohammed Shami, and Ravindra Jadeja are uncertain as selectors prepare for the Champions Trophy. Yashasvi Jaiswal is a strong contender for a spot.

'Missing' child of Atul Subhash in Haryana boarding school, Bengaluru cops toldAtul Subhash suicide case: A school in Faridabad confirmed that Atul Subhash's missing child was staying at its hostel. The development comes at a time when the Supreme Court is hearing the plea of Atul's mother seeking custody of her grandson.

Marco ending explained: What Unni Mukundan film's post-credit scene meansUnni Mukundan's film Marco is making waves at the box office across India, and its intriguing post-credit scene has sparked several speculations. Is a sequel underway or was Marco a prequel to Mikhael? Here's decoding what the ending and post-credit scene of Marco meant.

Kangana Ranaut invites Priyanka Gandhi to watch Emergency: You will like itActor Kangana Ranaut invited Priyanka Gandhi Vadra to watch Emergency. The actor stressed the film's dignified portrayal of former Indian PM Indira Gandhi, avoiding sensationalism. The film releases on January 17.

OpenAI's Sam Altman accused of sexual abuse by sister, he calls it utterly untrueAnnie Altman made similar allegations against the OpenAI CEO in 2021 on social media but had not taken any legal action.

Could get someone killed: TED chief to Elon Musk on his social media postsThe TED chief's remarks come at a time when Elon Musk has openly targeted governments of nations like the UK and Germany. Chris Anderson called Musk's approach 'playground bullying'.

Won't deny accused is DMK sympathiser: MK Stalin on Anna university assault caseTamil Nadu chief minister MK Stalin admitted in Tamil Nadu assembly that the accused in the Anna University sexual assault case was a DMK sympathiser, but not a member. He assured that the state government is committed to ensuring justice for the victim through swift legal action.

Galileo Galilei and Stephen Hawking: 300 years apart, united by the cosmosStephen Hawking was born exactly 300 years after Galileo Galilei died. Their death and birth, exactly 300 years apart on January 8, link two scientific pioneers who turned our understanding of the universe upside down. On this symbolic day, we celebrate their spirit, their genius, and the unbroken thread of human enquiry that connects them.

Delhi man kills wife, seals face with tape before hiding body in bed box The Delhi Police arrested a man for killing his wife and planning another murder, uncovering chilling details of his actions, including concealing the body and researching dismemberment on YouTube.

Microsoft says it will fire more employees who are underperformingMicrosoft is preparing to fire more employees. The company has confirmed that this move will primarily target underperforming employees.
Mahindra BE 6, XEV 9e prices revealed for top trim, booking details outThe BE 6 and the XEV 9e are Mahindra's born electric vehicles based on the electric-origin INGLO platform.

Ekta Kapoor slams 'unprofessional actors' after Ram Kapoor's remarks on Bade Achhe…Ekta Kapoor called out 'unprofessional actors' after Ram Kapoor spoke about a controversial kissing scene in Bade Achhe Lagte Hain. Ram revealed he had reservations about the scene, but Ekta wanted it.

Two men, dog trapped in home surrounded by Palisades Fire. Terrifying viral videoThe terrifying video, shared widely on social media, shows massive walls of fire encircling the house, with one of the men filming the chaos as flames rage perilously close.

Delhi techie shares resignation letter going viral for one of the 'finest reasons'In a post on X, a Delhi-based techie shared a screenshot of a resignation email that an employee sent to their HR Department that quickly went viral for "one of the finest reasons".

Sensex tumbles 600 points today. 3 reasons why stock market is falling Stock market today: Multiple factors were behind today's nervousness on Dalal Street, including weaker growth estimates for FY25, worries over Q3 corporate earnings and the likelihood of fewer US rate cuts.

Watch: Nayanthara, Vignesh Shivan enjoy safari in Dubai with sons Uyir, UlagNayanthara and Vignesh Shivan's video with their sons enjoying the Dubai safari has gone viral. The couple celebrated New Year in Dubai.

Aamir Khan called me mad over controversial scene in Dil, says filmmaker Indra KumarDirector Indra Kumar recently recalled that Aamir Khan had expressed his discomfort regarding a controversial scene in the film Dil. The film starred Aamir and Madhuri Dixit.

Could barely breathe: Tillotama Shome recalls first reading session of Paatal Lok 2Actor Tillotama Shome, who has joined the cast of Paatal Lok 2, called working on the show a transformative experience. She reflected on her disbelief at being cast and praised the show's tight script and stellar team.
Mrunal Thakur replies to Pakistani actor Hania Aamir's parody accountMrunal Thakur responded to praise from Hania Aamir's parody account, sparking reactions from fans.

sports.headline: New Zealand batter Martin Guptill confirms retirement from international cricketOne of New Zealand's white-ball greats, Martin Guptill, announced on Wednesday, January 8 that he is retiring from international cricket. Guptill played a total of 367 games for New Zealand during his career.

Gavaskar and Border should have presented BGT trophy together: ClarkeMichael Clarke criticized the absence of Sunil Gavaskar at the Border-Gavaskar Trophy presentation, suggesting both legends should have been present to honor the series' legacy. Cricket Australia admitted the oversight, agreeing it would have been preferable to include Gavaskar.

100 percent, I will play for Pakistan again: Fakhar on playing Champions Trophy Fakhar Zaman said that he is confident of making a comeback for Pakistan and take part in the Champions Trophy. The 34-year-old hasn't played for Pakistan since the T20 World Cup last year in the West Indies and USA.

Malaysia Open: HS Prannoy overcomes Brian Yang and delay, Malvika Bansod advancesHS Prannoy overcame a major delay and Brian Yang to progress to the pre-quarters of the Malaysia Open on Wednesday, January 8. Malvika Bansod continued her fine form as she reached the next stage as well.

India to announce Champions Trophy 2025 squad before January 12: SourcesThe BCCI is expected to announce India's squad for the ICC Men's Champions Trophy 2025 by January 12, while the team for the five-match T20I series against England is likely to be revealed a day earlier.

Didier Deschamps on stepping down as France coach: 2026 a very good time to stopDidier Deschamps said that 2026 is a good time for him to stop as the France coach as he decided against renewing his current contract. Deschamps will be leaving the job which he took over in 2012.

New Zealand seal series with 113-run win over Sri Lanka in rain-marred 2nd ODI NZ vs SL: New Zealand defeated Sri Lanka by 113 runs in the rain-hit 2nd ODI to take a 2-0 unassailable lead in the three-match series in Hamilton.

Jasprit Bumrah achieves career-best rating after India's Test series lossJasprit Bumrah's career-best ICC rating of 908 points highlights his dominance in Test cricket, even as India suffered a 3-1 loss to Australia in the Border Gavaskar Trophy, missing out on the World Test Championship 2025 final.

I won't be surprised if Virat Kohli captains Test team again: Adam GilchristAustralia vs India: Former Australia wicketkeeper said Jasprit Bumrah might find it challenging to handle the full-time captaincy of the Test team. The legendary gloveman said he wouldn't be surprised if Virat Kohli takes up the leadership role in the Test team again.

Bumrah as Rohit Sharma successor in Test not a good idea: Mohammad KaifMohammad Kaif has advised against Jasprit Bumrah as India's Test captain, suggesting that batters KL Rahul or Rishabh Pant would be better options to maintain team balance if Rohit Sharma steps down from the leadership role.

Watch: Rishabh Pant arrives in India from Sydney, meets fans at airportRishabh Pant returned to India after a tough Border-Gavaskar Trophy, warmly greeting fans at Delhi Airport. Despite a forgettable series, his fiery knock in the final Test and charisma off the field keep fans hopeful for his resurgence.

Despite a forgettable series, his fiery knock in the final Test and charisma off the field keep fans hopeful for his resurgence.

Nitish Reddy to play Ranji Trophy after impressive Border-Gavaskar TrophyWhile Nitish Reddy is likely to feature in the last two rounds of Ranji Trophy for Andhra, Prasidh Krishna and Devdutt Padikkal are likely to link up with the Karnataka squad for the Vijay Hazare Trophy knockout stages.

Maheesh Theekshana bags ODI hat-trick, joins Vaas and Malinga in elite listNew Zealand vs Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI: Maheesh Theekshana became the seventh Sri Lankan bowler to take a hat-trick in men's ODI cricket. He achieved the landmark on Wednesday at Seddon Park in Hamilton.

India probable squad: Yashasvi set to be considered; doubts over Shami, JadejaRohit Sharma and Virat Kohli remain central to India's ODI squad, but the futures of KL Rahul, Mohammed Shami, and Ravindra Jadeja are uncertain as selectors prepare for the Champions Trophy. Yashasvi Jaiswal is a strong contender for a spot.

Champions Trophy 2025: Afghanistan appoint Pakistan great Younis Khan as mentorAfghanistan bolsters its coaching setup with Pakistan legend Younis Khan as mentor for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Known for his leadership and batting expertise, Younis aims to guide the team to new heights on the global stage.

Sydney Test odd one out as ICC releases pitch ratings for Border-Gavaskar TrophyAustralia vs India: The pitches in Perth, Adelaide, Brisbane and Melbourne received the best rating from the International Cricket Council. Sydney pitch was rated average after the series finale at the iconic SCG ended in three days.

Neymar agrees with Cristiano Ronaldo: Saudi Pro League better than Ligue 1Neymar has echoed Cristiano Ronaldo's remarks on the Saudi Pro League, endorsing its competitiveness over Ligue 1. Drawing from his experiences with Al Hilal, the Brazilian superstar highlighted the league's rising quality and influx of top-tier talent.

Michael Clarke praises Bumrah as best ever all-format pacerFormer Australia captain Michael Clarke said Jasprit Bumrah was the best all-format fast bowler after the Indian pacer took 32 wickets to rattle Australian batters in the recently concluded Test series.

Premier League: 7 potential January transfer deals to watch out forThe January transfer window promises excitement for Premier League fans, with Manchester United, Liverpool, and Manchester City preparing to make crucial moves to strengthen their squads for the second half of the season, ensuring high-stakes drama unfolds.

Sydney pitch was rated average after the series finale at the iconic SCG ended in three days.

Two-tier Test cricket system proposal fair? South Africa's Graeme Smith reactsFormer South Africa captain Graeme Smith said teams like South Africa, West Indies and Sri Lanka need to be strong to ensure Test cricket remains competitive. The legendary cricketer expressed concerns about the reportedly proposed idea of a two-tier system for the traditional format.

Arteta blames Carabao Cup ball for Arsenal's 0-2 loss to Newcastle UnitedMikel Arteta believes Arsenal's inability to adjust to the Carabao Cup ball played a role in Tuesday's 2-0 semifinal, first-leg loss against Newcastle United.

Didier Deschamps to step down as France manager after 2026 FIFA World CupFrance head coach Didier Deschamps will step down from the role when his current contract ends after the 2026 World Cup. Deschamps led Les Bleus to the 2018 World Cup title.

Sam Konstas reveals surprise chat with 'legend' Virat Kohli after MCG dramaYoung Australia opener Sam Konstas has revealed his post-match chat with Virat Kohli after the Boxing Day Test drama at the MCG. Konstas told Kohli that he idolises the Indian batting great.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
